Fall 2018

Redwood Counseling

UX/UI Design

‹Vivacity Healing›Minds at Peace

Challenge

As a new start up business, Redwood Counseling needed an overall look reflecting their brand name that would start attracting clients.

Role

Created brand identity and website with intuitive navigation and a clean, friendly interface.

Overview

Redwood Counseling is a local start-up company in Cincinnati that specializes in individual, couples, and group therapy. This was a brand new business with only a handful of clients that was in need for a logo and website.

Goals

I approached my design in three steps, while conducting research throughout:

  1. Consistant brand identity
  2. Intuitive navigation
  3. Clean visual interface

Inspiration

Deciding where to start on a project can be tricky. Luckily, the name ‘Redwood’ gave me ideas immediately. Redwood trees symbolize wellness, safety, longevity, wisdom, and communication.

1. Brand identity

This was my first task for this project, creating a brand identity. My goal was to find artifacts that tell their story and engage people with who the company is in a familiar and meaningful way. No matter the size of the company, brand identity is a crucial part of telling your story.

Effective branding is the ‘bread and butter’ of any successful business. Therefore, I created a consistent and meaningful way to build a compelling identity.

Shape. The heart + tree icon is a simple symbol of emotion. It represents the balance between human emotion and nature.

Color. The colors my client and I came up with are simple, black and white. This allows for flexibility and represents balance.

2. Navigation

The next step in this project was creating a simplified website. First, I used Adobe XD to wireframe the navigation for a smooth user experience.

Users come to websites for products and services. They should be able to quickly and easily find what they are looking for.

Here’s a few things I wanted to keep in mind throughout the navigation design process that truly make or break a user experience.

  1. Clear navigation location
  2. Limit the amount of menus on a page
  3. Clear objective
  4. Avoid information overload

I wanted our websites navigation to aid visitors decisions. It truly controls how and when content is served to them, and moves them along the journey of Redwood Counseling.

3. Visual interface

Since this was a site that I was creating from scratch, it was slightly different than my other projects. Normally, I would recreate something that included a lot of common errors when designing a website and turn it into something better.

Did you know that first time users make up the first impression about a web page in 5 seconds? Just a few seconds and people will determine if the site is worth going forward or not.

Visual appearance is crucial. However, a great site goes far beyond just “looking good”. With that said, most users will establish a relationship between aesthetics and how easy it is to use and the quality of content delivered to them from the website.

As I designed the website to visually optimize for potential clients I followed my “less is more” motto. Sites can feel often feel complicated, so I wanted to try something with low visual complexity.

By decreasing the number of available options and simple visual indicators, it can make the experience feel like a walk through the park.

Lastly, my main goals were to keep everything consistent by paying attention to typography, UI elements and color.

Landing page

The white logo and navigation menu against the forest hero image creates great contrast on the site. I’ve researched that clear and fresh contrast is very important to users.

My main goal for the landing page was to create a feeling and mood. I wanted people to feel like the were walking through a enchanted forest on their way to recovery.

Conclusion

Yay! We designed a very successful brand identity and website with intuitive navigation and a clean, friendly interface.

The owner of Redwood Counseling is extremely pleased with the site overall, and because I used Squarespace she can easily update her info.

We have already received several compliments about the site on it's functionality and elegance.

Now when people think of Redwood Counseling our nature aesthetic comes to their minds.

That's a wrap!

You can check out more of my work on Instagram and Dribbble.

Minds at Peace
